comments.commentBody: They declared that they want to build more nuclear plants few months ago. Remember? It was in the news!!

Of course they are.  They know that they're dealing with a couple of paaeasment oriented idiots in Odumbo and Clinton. Why shouldn't they do whatever they want?  With these two clowns running our foreign policy, everyone in the world is laughing at us, and our enemies are partying.
I don't think Iranians   are  capable to built new  atomic sites. He is only trying to warn United States and Western Nations with their cheap propoganda.!!!!!!

Do you think that this make belief world of Sanger and Broad would change the discussion that we are having re The National/Global Security Interest of US and the interest of the Netenyahu and his coalition in Israel and the US?
It better not, because it is in our National Interest to have lasting peace in Middle East.
Our Security problem is tied with the killings in Gaza and the West Bank and not with Iran.

Frankly, I am not concerned about Iran's possible nukes in the hands of the Mullahs. I am more concerned about Israel's REAL nuke arsenal and delivery systems in the hands of extremist zealots, out of control and ready to start a war of unknown proportions and consequences to the USA based on some emotional notion of an existential threat. Our national media plays a dangerous game of fearmongering by overplaying the Iran hate card while painting Israel as a defenseless victim.

Our President Obama said very clearly that United States will not attack any nations of the world. Our Iraq and Afghan war was started by our former president Bush Jr. And we are still stucked  over there. War is not a good thing, tens of thousands of innocent Iraqis and Afganis died in their country on American name.!!!!!!!!

The authors write, “This article was based on interviews with officials of several governments and international agencies deeply involved in the hunt for additional nuclear sites in Iran, and familiar with the work of the I.A.E.A., the only organization with regular access to Iran’s known nuclear facilities.”

(1) Why are NYT writers obliged to protect the names of these foreign governments? I understand not naming the officials, but these foreign governments are part of the story, and it is necessary to name them to identify any bias.

(2) The IAEA is the only organization with regular access to Iran's known nuclear facilities. Then let's wait until the IAEA confirms the new enrichment sites, which Iran, acknowledged in the authors' own tagline, does not have to give advance notice of until it actually begins building.

I echo the sentiments of those who have commented before me that this article is alarmist, and lacks the sort of information and balance that can easily be determined from far less biased sources available on the net; namely, access to IAEA actual documents and press releases, which time and again refute NYT quasi-ruminations on Iran.
Umm, I have a question. Are these the same intelligence people who told us that Saddam Hussein's Irak had weapons of mass destructions back in the Cheney-Rumsfeld Administration?

Who cares? I have not one day in my entire life given 10 seconds' thought to what Iran might be doing. I have the suspician that Iran would not even matter if we simply ignored it, as we should. I suspect that the Iranian threat is the one that the NY Times keeps reporting, not the one that exisits.

Today Iran is not a nuclear target.  Yet, as soon as it developes a nuclear weapons system then all present nuclear nations will bring Iran into their nuclear sights.  Thousands and and thousands of nuclear missles not now pointed at Iran will be set on a hair-trigger ready to go forth streaming across the sky in all their strange beauty to blast Iran at the slightest insult or infraction!!!  Successfully managing a nuclear weapons arsenal is much harder than developing the weapons in the first place.  Iran doesn't seem to have the societal skill set necessary to even manage it's own economy or it's internal politics much less the talent needed to govern peaceful mature membership in the nuclear club.    Ken C. Arnold Santa Monica, Ca

No one has been able to prove that the sites listed or others planned would be large enough to make nuclear powered heads or to spin uranium fast enough and hard enough to make 90% pure uranium.  Their underground stations are much smaller than ours(US) that are all underground in Utah fenced off.  Even Ahmedenijad  mentioned that having one is hardly comparable to 1800 each for Russia and USA and that's if and when 30% are dismantled. They need uranium facilities for civilian power since they have little hydropower--no water  in large quantities--and little knowledge or intent to make and use solar power.  The latter would work well in Iran in time but not 24/7 for 365 days since their winters are rainy and/or cloudy.  We need to lose our paranoia over Iran and just make sure Israel doesn't bomb them.  Israel paid no attention to Iran when  USA was attacking Iraq so what is the big difference now??  Only one I see is the greater number of bombs Israel has.  They are the dangerous one--not Iran.
Obama will not do anything and if he did, it would take him weeks to make a decision and then he would want a committee to check it again.
Propaganda. Don't buy this war their trying to sell us.

What is our country doing about it? Nothing! If you don't stand up to the bully, the bully gets worse until you do.

Unfortunately, the President's Plan A was to sweet talk our enemies into a new detente. When that failed, he had no Plan B.

Not good.
Based on Iran’s record of starting a war compared to the countries beating war drums against it, the probability of it starting a war first is close to zero.

Why should Iran not? They are at least a member of the 1968 Non Proliferation Treaty, which Israel is not.

Rufus

i grew up listening to the press talk about the threat from the soviet union and now as i age you want me to feel threatened by iran? no thanks. you should go back to obama-propaganda; its more your thing.

I refuse to believe anymore of this crap about Iran. They still can't justify the reasons for the Iraq War to my liking. Call me nuts, as I know many of you are predisposed to do, but I know there are many questions still left unanswered about the events of Sept. 11th, 2001 and they all point to a cover up.

You may say that that was Bush and now we have a nice guy who can accurately read teleprompters and he's black so he must be different. I'm not buying it. Our country is no longer run by the people and for the people, it's controlled by corporations and the military industrial complex. Google "Loose Change" and watch the final cut version, then tell me I'm nuts.

This is not to say Iran isn't trying to acquire nuclear weapons or hasn't been funding, arming and manning the insurgency in Iraq. It's saying they're scared to death of an American invasion and they're doing everything in their power thwart that possibility. Obama thinks that reducing American and Russian stock piles of nuclear arms to 1,500 warheads is showing commitment to a world free of nuclear arms? It's a smoke screen. That's still more than is required to annihilate the entire planet. How is Iraq supposed to feel safer or more inclined to commit themselves to a non-proliferation treaty?

I smell a rat.

The paper "of the record" calls that "news"???

WAPO reported on Nov 30, 2009:

"Ahmadinejad vows dramatic expansion of Iran's nuclear program"

By Thomas Erdbrink
Washington Post Foreign Service
Monday, November 30, 2009

"TEHRAN -- Iran's government will build 10 new sites to enrich uranium, President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said Sunday, a dramatic expansion of the country's nuclear program and one that is bound to fuel fears that it is attempting to produce a nuclear weapon. "

So Iran is "suspected" to do what it said it would do?

Wow - never expected that ...

So what if Israel has weapons?  This has nothing to do with the UN resolutions that Iran is supposed to obey as a member of the international community.  The same people that point this out are the same people who blame Israel for defying UN resolution 242, and the same people who in turn give Iran a pass for flouting their own UN resolutions.  Stow the hypocrisy people.  Quit blaming the USA and Israel for every lawbreaker on the planet.
I trust Obama's judgment on this. He won't go overboard like Bush did with Iraq but I think the past few weeks have shown he can also be assertive enough when the occasion calls for it.

This administration's handling of the Iran nuclear threat is so incredibly inept that it makes the George Bush administration look stellar.  President Obama's foreign policy is doing the United States no favors; it's almost as if he doesn't care, either.

RIGHT TO BEAR ARMS?

In light of the Supreme Court's increasingly broad interpretaion of the "right to bear arms" in the second amendment, one wonders if that includes nuclear weapons? How about Iranian Americans? Just Asking!

SS

This person is either confused about what constitutes a nuclear site (as in militarized), or he is a goofball:

G.I.Joe
NYC
March 27th, 2010
3:40 pm
While I don't want any Iranian nuclear sites, isn't America planning new nuclear sites? Lets stop both new Iranian and American nuclear sites.
I guess Obama didn't apologize enough...I thought he has.
